alert.note: Alert for Brooks; Inland Cameron; Inland Kenedy; Inland Willacy; Northern Hidalgo; Southern Hidalgo; Starr (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Heat Advisory issued June 21 at 2:42PM CDT until June 21 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...HEAT ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING... ...HEAT ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 7 PM CDT THURSDAY... ...EXCESSIVE HEAT WARNING IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...Heat index values up to 115 today and Thursday. * WHERE...Hidalgo, Brooks, Inland Kenedy, Starr, Inland Willacy, and Inland Cameron Counties. * WHEN...For today`s Heat Advisory, until 8 PM CDT this evening. For the Thursday`s Heat Advisory, from noon to 7 PM CDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Hot temperatures and high humidity may cause heat illnesses to occur. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The cumulative effect of very hot and humid days with sultry nights where heat index fails to fall below 90 degrees compounds the impact of the heat on vulnerable populations who may not have access to cooler locations. Heat illness can be worsened by this effect, so at-risk populations are urged to seek relatives or cooling centers with air conditioning overnight.
info.instruction: Drink plenty of fluids, stay in an air-conditioned room, stay out of the sun, and check up on relatives and neighbors. Young children and pets should never be left unattended in vehicles under any circumstances. Take extra precautions if you work or spend time outside. When possible reschedule strenuous activities to early morning or evening. Know the signs and symptoms of heat exhaustion and heat stroke. Wear lightweight and loose fitting clothing when possible. To reduce risk during outdoor work, the Occupational Safety and Health Administration recommends scheduling frequent rest breaks in shaded or air conditioned environments. Anyone overcome by heat should be moved to a cool and shaded location. Heat stroke is an emergency! Call 9 1 1.
